; 习近平主席周二呼吁，加大污染防治力度，加快发展方式绿色转型，实现到2035年建设美丽中国、生态环境根本改善的目标。

;

; 中共中央总书记、国家主席、中央军委主席习近平在主持召开中央全面深化改革委员会第三次会议时作出上述表示。兼任该委员会主任。

;

; 会议审议通过了一系列文件。全面推进美丽中国建设，完善国有资本经营预算制度，完善自然垄断行业监管机制，加强对专家参与公共决策的监督，加强对国有资本运营的区域管控。

;

; 习近平在会上表示，美丽中国是全面建设社会主义现代化国家的重要奋斗目标。他强调，到2035年，要继续打好污染防治攻坚战，增强生物系统的多样性、稳定性和可持续性，推动生态环境根本改善。

;

; 国有资本运营是生态文明建设的重要组成部分。在国家预算制度方面，习近平指出，要完善国有资本运营预算制度，完善国有资本收支管理，提高资本使用效率。

;

;在电力、石油天然气、铁路等自然垄断行业监管方面，习近平要求完善相关监管体制机制，加大国有经济对自然垄断行业的监管力度，更好满足国家经济发展的需要。建设现代化基础设施体系，更好维护国家安全。

;

; 习近平还强调加强专家论证的重要性。中央政治局常委李强、王沪宁、蔡奇中共中央政治局委员、中央全面深化改革委员会副主任出席会议。

;

; 会议强调，要按照全面深化改革新要求，加大环境问题攻坚力度。 ——以实际行动，推动经济社会高质量发展，逐步实现生态环境目标。

;

; 预算工作体现党和国家意志，集中国有资本涉及国家安全和国民经济的重要行业和关键领域、公共服务和应急能力领域、公益领域、前瞻性战略性新兴产业，更好服务推进新发展格局和高质量发展的需要。 ——高质量发展。

;

; 会议指出，自然垄断行业是我国国有经济结构的重点领域。完善监管体系，重点监管自然垄断行业实施国家重大战略和规划，履行国家安全责任和社会责任。

;

; ;曹德胜@chinadaily.com.cn;

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 05:52:05 +0800 001FRONT - Foreign trade performance will continue to improve, experts sayhttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-11/08/content_001_654aaa27ed50d203d2ca220e.htm#001FRONT

; 10月份中国外贸同比增长，自7月份以来降幅不断收窄，增添了近期世界经济逐步企稳的迹象。官员和分析师表示，得益于一系列支持性政策措施，中国成为第二大经济体。

;

; 随着全球市场拥抱消费，未来几个月中国的外贸表现将继续改善他们补充说，节日期间的繁荣，基数效应逐渐减弱，将为世界经济复苏注入急需的动力。

;

; 10月，中国外贸进出口总值3.54万亿元人民币（4860亿美元），同比增长0.9%。海关总署周二公布的数据显示，与去年相比，出口下降3.1%至1.97万亿元人民币，而进口则大幅增长6.4%至1.57万亿元人民币。

;

; #39; 国家统计局新闻发言人吕大良表示，近期，外贸行业运行情况良好，10月份商品贸易同比增长。

;

; 国家统计局最新公布的贸易景气调查显示，吕表示，对未来进出口增长持乐观态度的企业比例有所上升，中国外贸将延续上升势头。

;

; 中国10月份进口数据，以美元计价自3月份以来首次出现正增长，表明内需逐步复苏——中国光大银行分析师周茂华表示，这是支撑国家经济持续复苏的重要动力。

;

; 国际货币基金组织预测，2023年中国经济将增长5.4%，实现了 5% 左右的增长目标。

;

; 国际货币基金组织第一副总裁吉塔·戈皮纳特 (Gita Gopinath) 表示，这一预测从 10 月份的 5% 上调，反映出第三季度的增长强于预期季度产出和近期政策公告。

;

; 在世界商品前景黯淡的情况下，李强总理在上海举行的第六届中国国际进口博览会开幕式上表示，中国将进一步扩大市场准入，增加进口

;

; 李克强重申北京致力于推进对外开放，表示未来五年货物和服务进口累计将达到17万亿美元。

;

; >;

; 尽管全球经济下行压力加大、地缘政治紧张局势加剧仍对中国出口活动构成拖累，但由于中国制造业升级的持续努力，出口结构不断改善

;

; 执信投资研究院高级研究员常然表示，10月份我国出口同比降幅较9月份扩大2.5个百分点，外部环境严峻、全球需求低迷，经济发展仍面临严峻挑战。他表示，这表明出口复苏的基础尚未完全建立。

;

;李强总理手持周二在北京举行会谈之前，澳大利亚总理安东尼·艾博内塞在人民大会堂举行欢迎仪式。

;

; 北京和堪培拉同意继续加强在政治对话、贸易、应对气候变化等方面的接触。根据周二发布的联合声明，双方承诺继续稳定和发展双边关系，以应对气候变化和人文交流。

;

; 两国总理在北京会晤后发表了该声明李强与澳大利亚总理安东尼·艾博内塞周二结束了对中国为期四天的正式访问。

;

; 双方“一致认为，两国可以发展双边关系，维护各自国家利益”声明称，“如果他们明智地处理分歧”。

;

; 与此同时，两国承诺恢复政府间机制，包括年度领导人会议。

;

; 为了进一步促进贸易和经济联系，双方誓言将努力就标准、衡量、知识产权等方面达成谅解备忘录。

;

; 李克强在人民大会堂与阿尔巴内斯会谈时强调了北京的立场中方愿同堪培方本着相互尊重和理解的精神，进一步加强对话沟通，深化政治互信，妥善处理分歧。

;

; 双方要把合作作为中澳关系的主流

;

; 李克强强调，中澳合作潜力巨大，中方愿同澳方共同努力，巩固和加强在传统领域的合作。双方愿在能源资源等领域加强绿色发展、数字经济、科技创新、医疗卫生等领域合作。

;

;

;

; 据媒体声明，双方同意为两国人民提供三至五年多次往返签证。阿尔巴尼斯告诉李，他的访问是为了推进自爱德华·高夫·惠特拉姆访华以来五十年来的双边关系，这是两国领导人首次访问中国。澳大利亚总理“为我们两国人民做出了如此多的贡献”。

;

; “作为具有不同历史、政治制度和价值观的国家，澳大利亚和中国不会被定义为我们的分歧，但将取决于我们如何解决这些问题，”根据会议的正式记录，他说道。

;

; “我们的地理位置、经济互补性以及密切的民间联系使我们成为现在和未来的重要合作伙伴。这就是为什么我们两国之间全面恢复自由、畅通的贸易如此重要。”他说。

;

; 在会后的新闻发布会上，阿尔巴内塞称这次访问“非常成功”。与李的对话“非常有建设性”。

;

; “对话总是一件好事。”当中国占我们出口额的四分之一以上，而澳大利亚四分之一以上的就业机会依赖于我们的出口时，这是一种重要的关系，”他告诉记者。

;

; 他还表示，他期待与中国继续在共同感兴趣的领域进行接触，并支持地区稳定与安全。 “这是澳大利亚最重要的关系之一。 ……它增强了我们的经济，有助于支持就业和商业，并为我们的国家奠定了安全和繁荣的未来。”

;

; 分析人士将阿尔巴尼斯的这次访问描述为标志着近年来，由于贸易问题和其他挑战，北京与堪培拉的关系陷入困境。

;

; 南京大学国际关系学院院长朱峰表示，阿尔巴尼斯的访问标志着两国已经翻开了过去几年政治和贸易关系动荡的一页，迎来了关系的新阶段。

;

; “澳大利亚政府的建设性和战略性政策选择无疑将推动两国关系的发展。”有利于两国和地区和平与合作的利益。”

;

; 中国社会科学院国家国际战略研究院研究员张杰表示，中澳关系解冻显示了务实主义对于稳定亚洲关系的重要性。

;

; “这表明经济脱钩和安全问题的过度延伸不符合所有国家的利益，”她说。

;

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 05:52:05 +0800 001FRONT - DINERS RELISH THE TASTE OF COMMUNITY CANTEENShttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-11/08/content_001_654aaa30ed50d203d2ca2211.htm#001FRONT

;居民排队吃午餐浙江省杭州市紫金社区之家养老服务中心食堂。

; ;

;浙江湖州，工人在社区食堂就餐。

; ;

;杭州复兴里社区食堂成为市民“必去”的地方适合所有年龄段的目的地。

; ;

;志愿者在浙江绍兴的社区食堂做饭。

; ;

; 在浙江省省会杭州市上城区的一家社区食堂，方文静只花了 20 元（2.75 美元）就吃上了一顿营养均衡的午餐，包括荤菜、蔬菜和一碗米饭。< /p>;

; “菜品有一种熟悉的家常菜味道，正如我所料。食堂也很干净。”从事培训行业的方女士说道。

;

; 她通过餐厅点评应用大众点评发现了这家店，位置便利，距离她家一公里，价格实惠。

;

; 10月21日，方某来到食堂当天，一个小时内，食堂的顾客就从老年食客变成了年轻人。

;

; “我以前订过好几份外卖” ，但是今天，我想要一道新鲜出炉的热腾腾的菜，”方说，并补充说，老年人普遍将此类菜肴视为“安慰食品”。

;

; 近年来，社区食堂的受欢迎程度激增，尤其是在年轻一代中。凭借时尚的设计和多样化的菜单，它们已成为许多人下班后的就餐选择，因为它们提供了外卖和外出就餐的替代选择。

;

; 虽然这些食堂继续为人们提供便利和实惠，他们还迎合了年轻一代的用餐喜好，延长了营业时间并改进了设计。这种用餐偏好的转变为这些社区食堂注入了新的活力。

;

; 方探访的食堂于二月开业，位于紫金社区之家养老服务中心一楼，作为社区食堂的服务中心。

;

;中心助理张素霞介绍，食堂的厨师会先为老年居民做特色餐，然后再为其他顾客做菜。

; < p>;“老年人的食物要煮得软一些，味道要淡一些，油要少一些。”张说。

;

; 食堂为老年人提供特别优惠。 60岁至79岁的顾客可享受80%的折扣，80岁至89岁的顾客可享受70%的折扣，90岁以上的顾客可享受50%的折扣。

;

; 张说，老年顾客经常早点来食堂。例如，他们上午10点30分左右到达等待午餐。菜品上好后，食堂就开始服务，中午左右小顾客就到了。

;

; 市民在食堂用餐卡充值500元，可获余额580元.

;

; “我们的许多年轻顾客似乎总是用餐卡收费，”张女士说。

;

; 自食堂开业以来，每个工作日都会有一群来自附近公司的年轻白领到食堂吃午饭。

;

; “他们了解我们的厨师，有时会要求他们烹饪菜单上没有的菜肴。我们有很多像这群人一样的常客，他们在附近生活或工作。”

;

; 食堂晚上7点就关门了，但张表示，可以根据年轻顾客的喜好延长营业时间。要求。 “当有这样的需求时，我们通常会在晚上 8 点关门，有时甚至更晚，”

;

; 传统节假日，食堂提供套餐，食客需要提前预订。

;

; “工作日食堂生意较多，我们只在周末提供午餐，因为我们认为周末是年轻人和老年人与朋友和家人一起吃饭的时间。”

;

; ;必去之地;

;

;一家时尚创新的社区食堂，自在杭州上城复兴里社区开业以来，人气越来越高。今年年初。已成为“必游之地”

;

; 老人们一早锻炼完后就聚集在食堂的露台上聊天放松。下午，食堂就成了很多年轻上班族的工作场所。

;

;大众点评用户“粗壮切洛里66”说：“虽然是社区食堂，但也可以说是西餐厅。”内部设计精美，氛围极佳，清洁程度很高。绿化也很丰富。”

;

; 食堂负责人胡一帆介绍，食堂的顾客中，有30%左右是60岁以上的老人，剩下的70%多是年轻人。

;

; >;

; 食堂为素食餐厅，提供多种套餐，均价28元。这些餐点包括一份主菜、一份米饭、一碗汤、水果沙拉和一份配菜。

;

; 食堂厨师周义刚表示，套餐很用心。出，注重营养平衡。

;

; 每道菜的烹饪都是根据顾客的喜好定制的。年龄阶层。对于年纪较大的食客来说，菜品鲜嫩，火锅味道清淡。年轻的顾客可以享用质地更脆的菜肴。

;

;“豆腐显然是我们食堂最受欢迎的食材之一，但吸引年轻食客的主要是氛围。”周说。 "食堂已经成为一个时尚的互联网场所，很多年轻顾客都会去那里充分沉浸在这种体验中。

;

; "我们的老顾客思想比较开放。他们乐于接受新事物，因此也很欣赏食堂的氛围。”

;

; 周补充说，越来越多的人愿意尝试素食，包括年轻一代和老一辈。于是，越来越多的此类餐厅在杭州开业。

;

; ;创新经营;

;

;上城闸弄口社区社区食堂近日开业“幸福盲盒”，每盒仅需6元，包含一荤一素。每天晚上 7 点开始销售。

;

; 这些菜肴均包装在透明容器中，但为了保持惊喜，在“主菜”的盖子上贴了贴纸。每个盒子的部分。 “盲盒”推出后受到欢迎，有的晚上到晚上8点左右就卖光了。

;

; 闸弄口社区党委书记吴岩说，这些社区餐厅被称为“幸福食堂”。 ;

;

; 闸弄口街道推出的送餐服务，确保老人家步行10分钟内就餐，或5分钟内送餐。这项服务也受到了在该地区生活和工作的年轻人的欢迎。

;

; 吴说，年轻顾客的增加给社区食堂带来了显着的推动。

;

; 改善膳食补助针对老年人服务问题，民政等地方政府部门纷纷出台政策，根据当地需求，对食堂建设以及老年人就餐费用给予不同程度的补贴。

;

; 7月，商务部等13个部门联合制定的到2025年三年行动计划，强调探索发展社区食堂、建立老年人助餐服务。

;

; 数据中国领先的企业信息提供商天眼查的数据显示，全国有6700多家社区食堂在运营。

;

; 北京联合大学旅游学院教授严旭阳表示，前景广阔对于社区食堂。他预计，到 2035 年，1970 年代至 2000 年代出生的人将成为此类商店的主要客户群体。

;

; 这一代人拥有合理的可支配收入水平，其中许多成员可能缺乏严说，自己做饭的意愿或意愿。

;

; 社区食堂的成功运营取决于其能否无缝融入当地居民的日常生活和文化。除了提供适合当地口味的菜肴、营造温馨的就餐环境外，拓宽这些食堂的功能也至关重要。

;

; 商城南星街道办事处工作人员翁英说，说社区食堂用于文化活动和其他活动，包括以烘焙和营养为重点的培训课程和研讨会。

;

;此类举措旨在提高当地社区对这些食堂的认识并培养对这些食堂的积极看法。< /p>;

; 去年下半年，杭州资阳街道维康社区食堂实现了从老年人食堂到面向全社区餐饮的重大转变。其服务范围已超出常规运营范围，包括为医院和企业提供服务，并提供送货上门服务。

;

;

;

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 05:52:05 +0800 002PAGE TWO - DINERS RELISH THE TASTE OF COMMUNITY CANTEENShttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-11/08/content_002_654aaa30ed50d203d2ca2212.htm#002PAGE TWO
;
;;

;居民排队吃午餐浙江省杭州市紫金社区之家养老服务中心食堂。

; ;

;浙江湖州，工人在社区食堂就餐。

; ;

;杭州复兴里社区食堂成为市民“必去”的地方适合所有年龄段的目的地。

; ;

;志愿者在浙江绍兴的社区食堂做饭。

; ;

; 在浙江省省会杭州市上城区的一家社区食堂，方文静只花了 20 元（2.75 美元）就吃上了一顿营养均衡的午餐，包括荤菜、蔬菜和一碗米饭。< /p>;

; “菜品有一种熟悉的家常菜味道，正如我所料。食堂也很干净。”从事培训行业的方女士说道。

;

; 她通过餐厅点评应用大众点评发现了这家店，位置便利，距离她家一公里，价格实惠。

;

; 10月21日，方某来到食堂当天，一个小时内，食堂的顾客就从老年食客变成了年轻人。

;

; “我以前订过好几份外卖” ，但是今天，我想要一道新鲜出炉的热腾腾的菜，”方说，并补充说，老年人普遍将此类菜肴视为“安慰食品”。

;

; 近年来，社区食堂的受欢迎程度激增，尤其是在年轻一代中。凭借时尚的设计和多样化的菜单，它们已成为许多人下班后的就餐选择，因为它们提供了外卖和外出就餐的替代选择。

;

; 虽然这些食堂继续为人们提供便利和实惠，他们还迎合了年轻一代的用餐喜好，延长了营业时间并改进了设计。这种用餐偏好的转变为这些社区食堂注入了新的活力。

;

; 方探访的食堂于二月开业，位于紫金社区之家养老服务中心一楼，作为社区食堂的服务中心。

;

;中心助理张素霞介绍，食堂的厨师会先为老年居民做特色餐，然后再为其他顾客做菜。

; < p>;“老年人的食物要煮得软一些，味道要淡一些，油要少一些。”张说。

;

; 食堂为老年人提供特别优惠。 60岁至79岁的顾客可享受80%的折扣，80岁至89岁的顾客可享受70%的折扣，90岁以上的顾客可享受50%的折扣。

;

; 张说，老年顾客经常早点来食堂。例如，他们上午10点30分左右到达等待午餐。菜品上好后，食堂就开始服务，中午左右小顾客就到了。

;

; 市民在食堂用餐卡充值500元，可获余额580元.

;

; “我们的许多年轻顾客似乎总是用餐卡收费，”张女士说。

;

; 自食堂开业以来，每个工作日都会有一群来自附近公司的年轻白领到食堂吃午饭。

;

; “他们了解我们的厨师，有时会要求他们烹饪菜单上没有的菜肴。我们有很多像这群人一样的常客，他们在附近生活或工作。”

;

; 食堂晚上7点就关门了，但张表示，可以根据年轻顾客的喜好延长营业时间。要求。 “当有这样的需求时，我们通常会在晚上 8 点关门，有时甚至更晚，”

;

; 传统节假日，食堂提供套餐，食客需要提前预订。

;

; “工作日食堂生意较多，我们只在周末提供午餐，因为我们认为周末是年轻人和老年人与朋友和家人一起吃饭的时间。”

;

; ;必去之地;

;

;一家时尚创新的社区食堂，自在杭州上城复兴里社区开业以来，人气越来越高。今年年初。已成为“必游之地”

;

; 老人们一早锻炼完后就聚集在食堂的露台上聊天放松。下午，食堂就成了很多年轻上班族的工作场所。

;

;大众点评用户“粗壮切洛里66”说：“虽然是社区食堂，但也可以说是西餐厅。”内部设计精美，氛围极佳，清洁程度很高。绿化也很丰富。”

;

; 食堂负责人胡一帆介绍，食堂的顾客中，有30%左右是60岁以上的老人，剩下的70%多是年轻人。

;

; >;

; 食堂为素食餐厅，提供多种套餐，均价28元。这些餐点包括一份主菜、一份米饭、一碗汤、水果沙拉和一份配菜。

;

; 食堂厨师周义刚表示，套餐很用心。出，注重营养平衡。

;

; 每道菜的烹饪都是根据顾客的喜好定制的。年龄阶层。对于年纪较大的食客来说，菜品鲜嫩，火锅味道清淡。年轻的顾客可以享用质地更脆的菜肴。

;

;“豆腐显然是我们食堂最受欢迎的食材之一，但吸引年轻食客的主要是氛围。”周说。 "食堂已经成为一个时尚的互联网场所，很多年轻顾客都会去那里充分沉浸在这种体验中。

;

; "我们的老顾客思想比较开放。 They readily embrace new things, which is why they also appreciate the atmosphere in the canteen."

;

; Zhou added that an increasing number of people are willing to try a vegetarian diet, including the younger and older generations. As a result, more restaurants serving this type of food are opening in Hangzhou.

;

; ;Innovative operation;

;

; A community canteen at the Zhanongkou Community in Shangcheng recently launched "happiness blind boxes", which cost just 6 yuan per box and contain one meat dish and a vegetarian dish. Sales start at 7 pm each evening.

;

; The dishes are packaged in transparent containers, but to maintain an element of surprise, stickers are placed over the lid of the "main dish" section of each box. The "blind boxes" have become popular since being introduced, and on some nights they sell out by about 8 pm.

;

; Wu Yan, Party secretary at the Zhanongkou Community, has said these community restaurants are known as "Happiness Canteens."

;

; A meal assistance program introduced in Zhanongkou subdistrict ensures the elderly can access meals within a 10-minute walk of their homes, or have them delivered within five minutes. The service has also been welcomed by younger people living and working in the area.

;

; Wu said the rising numbers of young customers have given community canteens a significant boost.

;

; To improve meal assistance services for the elderly, local government departments, including those responsible for civil affairs, have introduced policies to provide different levels of subsidies for canteen construction, along with dining expenses for the elderly, based on local needs.

;

; In July, a three-year action plan through 2025 drawn up by 13 such departments, including the Ministry of Commerce, stressed the importance of exploring the development of community canteens and establishing meal assistance services for the elderly.

;

; Data from Tianyancha, a leading corporate information provider in China, show that more than 6,700 community canteens are operating nationwide.

;

; Yan Xuyang, a professor at Beijing Union University's Tourism College, said there are promising prospects for community canteens. He envisions that by 2035, those born from the 1970s to the 2000s will comprise the main group of customers for such outlets.

;

; This generation has a reasonable level of disposable income, and many of its members may either lack the inclination or willingness to prepare meals for themselves, Yan said.

;

; The successful operation of community canteens hinges on their ability to seamlessly integrate into the daily lives and culture of local residents. In addition to serving dishes to suit local tastes, and fostering a welcoming environment for diners, it is vital to widen the functions of these canteens.

;

; Weng Ying, a staff member at the Nanxing subdistrict office in Shangcheng, said community canteens are used for cultural activities and other events, including training sessions and seminars focused on baking and nutrition.

;

; Such initiatives are designed to boost awareness and foster a positive perception of these canteens among local communities.

;

; In the latter part of last year, the Weikang community canteen in Ziyang subdistrict, Hangzhou, underwent a significant transformation from being a canteen for seniors to catering for the whole community. Its services have been broadened beyond regular operations to include services for hospitals and businesses, complete with home delivery options.

;

; Some community canteens have introduced innovative self-service models. Beijing's Lugu Community in Shijingshan district has adopted a self-service approach, catering to local residents while also attracting customers from nearby commercial buildings.

;

; Jin Jing, director of the Lugu subdistrict office, said the buffet-style dishes are priced at just 2.48 yuan per 100 grams, with a minimum order of at least 250 grams. This price is lower than those of neighboring eateries.

;

; In Shenyang, capital of Liaoning province, a community canteen in Huanggu district has launched a set breakfast menu for a whole month, priced at 120 yuan.

;

; As the elderly may face challenges in cooking, and many young people lack culinary skills, the community has converted long-vacant retail spaces into a canteen.

;

; The outlet, which is open from 6 am to 10 pm each day, features a wide range of dishes low in salt and sugar. Less oil is also used to cook them.

;

; This diverse menu with affordable prices has made the canteen exceptionally popular.

;

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 05:52:05 +0800 003TOP NEWS - Foreign chip firms optimistic in China markethttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-11/08/content_003_654aaa33ed50d203d2ca2213.htm#003TOP NEWS
;
;

; Multinational chip companies are highlighting their commitment to the Chinese market at the sixth China International Import Expo, as the country's fast-growing semiconductor sector and digital transformation push are bringing huge opportunities, corporate executives and experts said.

;

; Chip companies from the United States, Japan, the Netherlands, South Korea and other countries have set up big booths at the ongoing CIIE in Shanghai. Their large-scale presence reflects their enthusiasm to tap into the world's largest semiconductor market, experts said.

;

; Despite some voices calling for geopolitically driven "decoupling "or "de-risking" in technology, there is a consensus that global cooperation is vital for the semiconductor industry and China's appeal will only grow with its increasing clout in the global semiconductor industrial chain, they added.

;

; Shen Bo, senior vice-president of Dutch semiconductor equipment company ASML, said that China continues to be one of the company's important business markets, and its local business has grown "very fast" this year. The company, is participating in the CIIE for the fifth time.

;

; Though the US' latest chip export control measures could affect the company's China business to some extent, "we are highly optimistic about the Chinese market's performance next year", because the robust local demand is expected to continue, Shen added.

;

; In the third quarter of this year, the Chinese market contributed to 46 percent of ASML's total revenue, up from 24 percent in the second quarter.

;

; Zhou Bing, vice-president of Intel, which has been present at six editions of the CIIE, said, "The Chinese market is of great significance for Intel's global development," adding that Intel hopes to provide support for the development of China's burgeoning digital economy.

;

; Frank Meng, chairman of Qualcomm China, said, "Qualcomm has consistently considered China as a pivotal business partner and valued customer, viewing it as more than just a market or a link in the supply chain."

;

; While visiting the booths of foreign companies during the CIIE, Minister of Commerce Wang Wentao said China's huge market has brought economic benefits to enterprises and made technology sustainable, expressing hope that foreign enterprises can continue to deeply cultivate the Chinese market.

;

; Zhong Xinlong, a senior consultant at the China Center for Information Industry Development Consultancy, said the semiconductor industry is the most globalized sector, and the companies' enthusiasm at the CIIE highlights that geopolitically driven "decoupling "or "de-risking" is unpopular.

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 05:52:05 +0800 003TOP NEWS - Exchanges seen as key for civilizationshttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-11/08/content_003_654aaa39ed50d203d2ca2215.htm#003TOP NEWS
;
;

; Dialogues between civilizations need to be strengthened, domestic and foreign experts said at the Inter-Civilizational Communication and Global Development Forum, which opened in Beijing on Tuesday.

;

; Xie Chuntao, executive vice-president of the Party School of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (National Academy of Governance), which organized the three-day forum, said the event aims to build an international exchange platform for people to contribute wisdom to promote exchanges and mutual learning between civilizations and build a community with a shared future for mankind.

;

; Speaking on the Chinese vision for a harmonious, peaceful, secure world and the goals of Chinese modernization, John Thornton, chair emeritus of the Brookings Institution, a nonprofit research group in Washington, DC, said: "We all agree the concept is the right one. What we have is the issue of execution."

;

; Thornton stressed the important and immediate need for communication within and among people throughout the world — a dialogue of civilizations on people-to-people communication in particular.

;

; "While the two countries sort out what is genuinely national security and what is not, trade will eventually resume and can be very robust," Thornton told China Daily.

;

; Zheng Bijian, former executive vice-president of the Party School of the Central Committee of the CPC and founding chairman of China Institute for Innovation and Development Strategy, said that China, while safeguarding its national sovereignty and territorial integrity, is pursuing its national development and modernization in a peaceful and civilized manner.

;

; The 91-year-old noted that exchanges and mutual learning among civilizations are the fundamental way to achieve modernization that conforms to a certain country's historical and cultural characteristics, and that China opposes protectionism, unilateral sanctions, barriers and decoupling.

;

; Former Belgian prime minister Yves Leterme said via video link that both China and the European Union embrace the ideals of multipolarity and economic globalization, and affirm their commitment to multilateralism.

;

; "It is really crucial to reinvigorate this partnership with enhanced trust and reduced mutual suspicion, embracing real openness over restrictions, and shared responsibilities over exclusion," he said.

;

; Leterme proposed a pluralistic approach to China-EU cooperation, which attaches great importance to people-to-people exchanges, economic cooperation and co-investment, as well as improved infrastructure links.

;

; Christine Cayol, founder of Yishu 8, or the Beijing Sino-French House of Art, who has been living in China for almost two decades, said that this experience has broadened her mindset and helped her understand other civilizations.

;

; Around 150 dignitaries, scholars, entrepreneurs and cultural celebrities from more than 30 countries and regions are attending the event themed "Tradition of Civilization and Paths to Modernization".

;

; Topics on exchanges among Chinese, European, Central Asian and Arab civilizations, as well as their paths to modernization, are being discussed at the event.

;

; A sub-forum on China-Europe inter-civilizational communication and mutual learning was also held on Tuesday. Attendees discussed topics such as how China and Europe, as important participants in the process of world multipolarity and economic globalization, can maintain dialogue in an open and inclusive manner, and how they can play a bigger role in maintaining world peace and stability, promoting global prosperity and sustainable development, and advancing human civilization.

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 05:52:05 +0800 003TOP NEWS - Nation's path to modernization inspiringhttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-11/08/content_003_654aaa3ced50d203d2ca2216.htm#003TOP NEWS
;
;;

;Teka Entehabu (left), former Ethiopian minister of trade and industry, interacts with other participants during the fourth Think Tank Forum on National Governance in Developing Countries in Beijing on Tuesday.

;

; The Chinese path to modernization, which is different from that of the West, has set an example for developing countries, according to experts at a forum on Tuesday.

;

; They made the remarks in Beijing at the fourth Think Tank Forum on National Governance in Developing Countries, which was themed "Paths to Modernization in Developing Countries". The event was held by the Party School of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (China National Academy of Governance), Institute of Party History and Literature of the CPC Central Committee, Peking University and China Daily.

;

; Josef Gregory Mahoney, associate editor of the United States-based Journal of Chinese Political Science, said, "The Western concept of universalism has always been a myth, and it's always been something that was poorly constructed and a historical narrative that the West used to justify a particular period of its history."

;

; After centuries of development, "the West believed that it had reached the endpoint of history that it had discovered, the one true path to development and human progress", he added.

;

; Alessandro Golombiewski Teixeira, former tourism minister of Brazil, said that a central argument of the Western modernization theory is that developing countries need to follow the same path as the West in order to develop, and that "they (developing nations) must adapt to Western cultures and values and industrialize their economies".

;

; Mahoney and Teixeira said that developing countries can look to China, which has found its own path, which is different from that of the West.

;

; Sun Shangwu, deputy editor-in-chief of China Daily, said that the Chinese path is "a modernization path that the CPC has independently and autonomously explored on Chinese soil".

;

; "The success of the Chinese path to modernization is due to its alignment with China's actual conditions, reflecting the will of the Chinese people, and meeting the requirements of the times," Sun said. "Chinese modernization shares common features with modernization in other countries but also has its unique Chinese characteristics."

;

; In opening remarks to the forum, Li Yi, vice-president of the Party School of the Central Committee of the CPC, said, "It was after more than 100 years of effort that China has finally stepped on its own path toward modernization."

;

; Li also referred to the third Belt and Road Forum for International Cooperation, held in Beijing last month, as "an important demonstration of the nation's commitment to joining hands with the whole world on the path toward modernization".

;

; Robert Walker, an emeritus fellow at Oxford University's Green Templeton College, highlighted China's success in modernization and the widening gap between developed and developing countries in past decades. He said that world poverty has fallen, but that has predominantly resulted from China's economic success, which has lifted 800 million people out of extreme poverty. However, the global population in extreme poverty has increased by 75 million since 2020, he said.

;

; Younes Abouyoub, chief of governance and state-building at the United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Western Asia, said that while a lack of effective modern governance is a problem facing many developing countries on their modernization path, the question that should be addressed is how to develop strong, capable state institutions that are committed to effective and efficient public service.

;

; Jeffrey Sachs, a professor at Columbia University's School of Public Affairs, said that China's economic development, especially that between 1980 and 2020, offers great lessons to other countries and "can actually serve as a road map for world development in the next 40 years".

;

; With headwinds from US attempts to stop China's rise by imposing trade, financial and technological restrictions, China should diversify its export market, especially through the Belt and Road Initiative, and build strong, long-term links with the rest of the world, especially the promising African region.

;

; Teka Entehabu, former Ethiopian minister of trade and industry, said the concept of modernization has many nuanced aspects, but the main focus in Africa will be on fostering ever-important industrial and economic development.

;

; In addition, he said, the BRI has made great contributions to African modernization. "The BRI has provided unprecedented opportunities for the economic growth and modernization of the region by addressing the inadequate state... of infrastructure, trade and technologies."

;

; Sachs, the Columbia University professor, said he expects China to continue working with other countries in order to advance human development and well-being in the decades to come.

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 05:52:05 +0800 003TOP NEWS - Principal from Taiwan nurtures students with Chinese culturehttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-11/08/content_003_654aaa3fed50d203d2ca2217.htm#003TOP NEWS
;
;;

;Hsiao Yung-ray

; ;

;Online See more by scanning the code.

;

; Hsiao Yung-ray, who is from Taiwan and works as a school principal on the Chinese mainland, has dedicated herself to preserving traditional Chinese culture through education and cultivating students who are proud to be Chinese.

;

; Born in Taipei, Taiwan, she returned to her family's ancestral home in Wuhan, Hubei province, in 2001, influenced by her father, a patriotic military officer and Wuhan native engaged in promoting exchanges between the two sides of the Taiwan Strait.

;

; She had earlier forged a successful career in the finance industry, working for institutions such as Merrill Lynch and Chase Manhattan Bank in the United States. However, feeling unfulfilled and seeking a greater purpose, she made the decision to return to her motherland.

;

; Having made her fortune in the real estate business, and becoming president of the Association of Taiwan Investment Enterprises in Wuhan, she turned her eyes to education.

;

; In 2005, she established Wuhan Meiga Academy, which was affiliated with Wuhan Foreign Language School, and serves as the academy's president. It now has about 3,000 students ranging from primary to senior high school.

;

; The school emphasizes the learning of traditional Chinese culture, including calligraphy and martial arts, alongside academic subjects, with the goal of nurturing students with both a deep understanding of their cultural heritage and a global perspective.

;

; Hsiao criticized attempts by the Taiwan authorities to sever ties with the mainland by revising history textbooks in recent years as a betrayal of the motherland.

;

; "The cultural bond between the two sides of the Taiwan Strait is unbreakable," she said. "Chinese will always be Chinese.… and Chinese from both sides pay respect to ancestors in festivals."

;

; She actively engages with students, teaching them traditional Chinese classics and sharing Chinese history stories to instill a sense of pride and appreciation for their cultural roots.

;

; "I tell Chinese history stories to students to demonstrate the value of Chinese culture and classics," she said. "Classics are lessons that the Chinese nation has accumulated from blood and tears throughout its history.

;

; "By teaching traditional culture to children, we don't expect to cultivate masters. Our goal is to cultivate people who know Chinese culture, and be proud of our own culture and of being Chinese."

;

; Hsiao said the results had exceeded her expectations and the students had become more willing to help others and had learned to reflect on themselves.

;

; "Learning Chinese classics in school helps me solve many problems I encounter in life," said Wang Yitong, a seventh-grade student. "We study to make ourselves men of virtue, not to gain fame. The goal of study is not to acquire high scores, but to pursue truth."

;

; Hsiao said she would encourage young Taiwan people to broaden their horizons, learn and consider staying on the mainland, where they would find abundant opportunities.
